commit.message: Fix test array iteration
Move more file-related stuff to fileHandler
Need to use mode
Fix MRO

Simplify planemo test setup

Just rely on installed seqeunce_utils.
Deduplicate file handling in fastqReader/Writer class
Use context manager in fastq_trimmer.py

fastqReader compat if non using context manager

Fixes:
```
|  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/galaxy_utils/sequence/scripts/fastq_trimmer.py", line 25, in main
|  for num_reads, fastq_read in enumerate(fastqReader(path=input_filename, format=input_type)):
|  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/galaxy_utils/sequence/fastq.py", line 664, in __iter__
|  yield next(self)
|  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/galaxy_utils/sequence/fastq.py", line 599, in __next__
|  id_line = self._read_fastq_header()  # We need the raw line1 to compare w/line3
|  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/galaxy_utils/sequence/fastq.py", line 613, in _read_fastq_header
|  line = self.file.readline()
|  AttributeError: 'fastqReader' object has no attribute 'file'
```

commit.message: Convert fastq reader/writer to context managers

Roll back changes to deinterlacer script

Based on decision to not include deinterlacing functionalty in groomer.
(as per discussion with @jennaj)

Refactoring + more fine-grained tests still a reasonable improvement,
but not as part of the groomer update - hense, rolling back.

Temporary fix: specify 'sanger' as default type

Input file type may be the empty string (as constructed in the tool
wrapper: with no 'fastq' prefix in the filename extension, the result is
the empty string). Thus, we need to provide a default.

Simplify code in previous commit

Just pass it as an argument!

Fix bug; modify code, add tests (See NOTE)

Bug: when an invalid fastq format is not fixed (by setting fix_id)
fastqVerboseErrorReader attempts to access the file to display error
details. However, the file is closed by its parent class before raising
fastsqFormatError. As a result, a ValueError is raised (I/O operation on closed file).

Solution: add close_on_error()
Simply overriding close() in fastqVerboseErrorReader would cause the
file to be left open when close() is called in legitimate cases.
Instead, we have a close_on_error() method which the parent class calls
in one case only; fastqVerboseErrorReader overrides the method and
closes the file directly after accessing it for error details.

Appropriate tests added to test_scripts.py.

Refactor Groomer; add tests

Groomer: factor out argument processing; use instance variablbes to
simplify unit testing.

Add tests; wrap Groomer tests in TestCase to use unittest's assertRaises.

Minor refactoring; relax PEP8 formatting

Move arg processing into Groomer class (no reason for keeping it in
top-level function)
Add fix_id option to groomer; test; minor cleanup
